bib.title: Measurement of double differential cross sections of secondary neutrons in the incident energy range 9 - 13 MeV

free_txt: Compiled by Liang Qichang at CNDC
vious reference moved to subents 002-006. new subent
012 added. METHOD, ERR-ANALYS, MONITOR and COMMENT
SD:Updated to new date formats,lower case.
Author's name corrected (Xiu Haiheng => Xiu Haihong);
The neutron detector is a liquid scintillator
with diameter of 10.4 cm and thickness of 5 cm.
7 MeV pulsed deuteron beam impinges on a
Hollow cylinder of depleted uranium metal or bismuth
with an outside diameter of 3 cm, inside diameter of
Data was provided by authors through private
Double differential cross section for secondary
neutrons including the elastic scattering neutrons.
Uncertainties estimated for double differential cross
An abnormal fast neutron time-of-flight spectro-
meter is introduced in which the distance between
neutron source and sample is 220 cm, and distance
between sample and neutron detector is 70 cm. With
this spectrometer the two groups of neutrons induced
by monoenergetic and break-up neutrons from the d+d
reaction are well separated in the tof spectrum.

neutrons including the elastic scattering neutrons.
